abstract: Microsoft’s chief executive says the new Windows 7 will speak for itself.
snippet: Microsoft’s chief executive says the new Windows 7 will speak for itself.
lead_paragraph: Steven A. Ballmer, Microsoft’s chief executive, began the year of Windows 7 Wednesday night at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas.

headline.main: Microsoft C.E.O. Steve Ballmer: Windows Is Still Relevant

abstract: Microsoft is paying Verizon Wireless and Dell to place its search engine on their devices. It isn’t clear it will help Microsoft gain market share.
snippet: Microsoft is paying Verizon Wireless and Dell to place its search engine on their devices. It isn’t clear it will help Microsoft gain market share.
lead_paragraph: Despite years of effort and significant investments, Microsoft has failed to make inroads in the Internet search business against Google. But in typical Microsoft fashion, the company keeps trying.

abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission has reopened an investigation into whether the hedge fund Pequot Capital Management used insider information to illegally profit from trading shares of Microsoft in 2001, press reports said.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission has reopened an investigation into whether the hedge fund Pequot Capital Management used insider information to illegally profit from trading shares of Microsoft in 2001, press reports said.

headline.main: S.E.C. Said to Reopen Pequot Inquiry

abstract: A regulatory filing reveals that Google had 1 million advertisers a year ago. It could have 1.5 million now.
snippet: A regulatory filing reveals that Google had 1 million advertisers a year ago. It could have 1.5 million now.
lead_paragraph: There are a few reasons Google makes so much more money than rivals like Yahoo and Microsoft in search advertising. First, it accounts for a lot more searches. Second, its technology is believed to be better at matching ads to queries. And third, it has more advertisers. A lot more.

headline.main: Google: 1 Million Advertisers in 2007, More Now
